summary:
Connecting language development with the teaching of content areas is a crucial  success factor in the education of pupils who come from non-academic backgrounds or who are studying through a language other than their mother tongue. Even refugee children  are in need of a language and content integrated pedagogy. All teachers can learn how to include language development in their subject teaching. My research and development work aims at providing (future) teachers and their trainers  with knowledge and tools in how this can be done.  
After having spent some intensive and interesting years as professor at Malmö University  I am now back as professor of applied sciences in Utrecht. Here I lead the international project on Inclusive Science Teaching in cooperation with Malmö University and  Innland University of Applied Sciences in Hamar, Norway. I also started up a research group on multilingualism in education together with prof. Rick de Graaff. In the national SPRONG-Multilingualism consortium  I coordinate a group of researchers who together with professionals from primary, secondary and vocational  education analyse  challenges in realizing inclusive education in different multilingual contexts.

I have worked with teachers of different school subjects to find ways of including language development in their content area teaching as a way to keep  high quality teaching in multicultural classrooms. My specialism is  interaction analysis as an instrument of getting a better understanding of   building understanding and constructing meaning in classroom talks.  Teachers  become inspired to work on the quality of their teaching and improving student involvement by looking systematically at their interaction practices. I have enjoyed supervising PhD trajectories to deepen our understanding of this field, which resulted in theses of a.o. Dubravka Knezic, Maria Kouns, Gerald van Dijk, Maria Rubin.
 
My goal is to  develop methods for schools, groups of teachers and teacher training to work  at this practical level, drawing on recent research on language and learning. I 'translate' research findings to  practice and write  research reports about innovative practice.  I strongly believe in  multidisciplinary research and have good contacts in  a.o. the field of mathematics, history  and biology. With my knowledge of Swedish, I promote  exchanges between Dutch and Swedish education and research in this field.
